intro: Pimpinella caffra subsp. caffra, commonly known as the African cowparsley, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a biennial or perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-white flowers in umbels. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in a variety of soil types. The plant is often found in open woodland, grasslands, and along roadsides.
